metadata.dc:author: Alonso Iñigo, J M
Herranz Gordo, A
Llopis Calatayud, J E
Fas Vicent, M J
metadata.dc:description: Noninvasive ventilation (NIV) can be useful to anesthesiologists working in critical care units, postanesthesia recovery units, operating theaters, or other settings. NIV can help in situations of acute respiratory failure or serve as a preventive measure in patients undergoing interventions under local-regional anesthesia or diagnostic or therapeutic procedures requiring sedation. Successful NIV depends on adequately trained health personnel and the proper choice of material (interfaces, respirators, etc.) for each setting where this modality is used.
metadata.dc:title: Aplicaciones de la ventilación mecánica no invasiva en anestesiologáa y reanimación.
[Applications of noninvasive mechanical ventilation in anesthesiology and postanesthesia recovery care].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de anestesiologia y reanimacion
